body:
hmm that's an interesting one. Should it dirty the form or not? If anyone else reading this issue, let me know your thoughts. 

- dirty / !pristine means the user has made a modification

i guess it kind makes sense that they have added a new field.
I think itâ€™s best to think of that way as @tomas-c said.
let me know if this beta fix the issue. react-hook-form@4.5.3-beta.2
That fixed it for me but found one strange case, left a comment about it in #839

@bluebill1049  still having trouble with 4.5.4

I've updated https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usefieldarray-9u12n to use 4.5.4

1. Append a field
2. Observe dirty=true  ðŸ‘ 
2. Click on the appended field and then outside it to trigger onBlur
3. Observe dirty=false ðŸ˜¢ 
4. Delete the appended field
5. Observe dirty=true ðŸ˜¢
thanks, I will take a look again tmr ðŸ‘

> Click on the appended field and then outside it to trigger onBlur
> Observe dirty=false ðŸ˜¢

patched
I've updated https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usefieldarray-9u12n to use 4.5.5, seems to still happen

> I've updated https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usefieldarray-9u12n to use 4.5.5, seems to still happen

i only highlight scenario 2 (the crying face), still working on the last one.
updated: https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usefieldarray-yikiz @tomas-c if you want to double confirm. we aim to release this during this weekend.

There's something weird happening there with 4.5.6-beta4...

1) Reload
2) Press append
3) Observe the state is incorrectly set to dirty=false
4) Press append again
5) Observe the state is correctly set to dirty=false
6) Press inside the last field and then outside it so that onBlur is triggered
7) Observe the state is incorrectly set to dirty=false again

> There's something weird happening there with 4.5.6-beta4... 1) Reload 2) Press append 3) Observe the state is incorrectly set to dirty=false 4) Press append again 5) Observe the state is correctly set to dirty=false 6) Press inside the last field and then outside it so that onBlur is triggered 7) Observe the state is incorrectly set to dirty=false again

thanks for testing. i miss this onBlur part.

thanks for testing @tomas-c 

https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usefieldarray-yikiz

let me know if the above CSB solves all the issues.
